newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shanghai Power plans US$300 mln offer in HK.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai Power plans US$300 mln offer in HK.

text.p: Shanghai Electric Power Co Ltd is planning to launch an initial public offering of H shares, shares listed in Hong Kong, by November to raise around US$300 million, a company spokesman said on Tuesday.
The power company has selected NatWest Markets as the lead underwriter, the spokesman told the Hong Kong-based newsletter China Securities Bulletin on Tuesday.

The company will use proceeds to build the Yangshupu Power Plant and Wujing Power Plant in Shanghai, he said, adding that the company has no details of share capital or profits due to its current restructuring of assets.
Shanghai Power is among 38 domestic enterprises approved by the Securities Commission of the State Council to list abroad.
The firm's assets will comprise four Shanghai-based power plants, and a shareholding company is expected to be set up in June, the spokesman said.
The company, based in Shanghai, supplies electricity to local consumers.
